warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend your arms out to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dipping it (cow) while breathing deeply. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Swing your arms open wide to the sides and then cross them in front of your chest. Perform 2 sets of 15 reps.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Sit down with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows pointed down and back.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Start with a weight that allows you to complete 10-12 reps with good form. Adjust as needed.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Find a pull-up bar and stand under it.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended.
3. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
4. Lower yourself back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use body weight or add assistance if needed to complete 6-8 reps.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your lats by imagining pulling your elbows down to your sides.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a neutral grip, palms facing each other.
2. Sit down with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with proper form. Adjust as needed.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Find a pull-up bar and stand under it.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the bar with a neutral grip, palms facing each other.
2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended.
3. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
4. Lower yourself back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use body weight or add assistance if needed to complete 6-8 reps.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your core engaged to prevent swinging and maintain a steady movement.

exercises.exercise_name: Half Kneeling One Arm Lat Pull Down
exercises.setup: Kneel on one knee and brace against a bench or your knee for stability.
execution: 1. Grip the handle with one hand, palm facing in.
2. Pull the cable down by driving your elbow down and back.
3. Focus on engaging your lat as you pull.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching arms.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps per arm with good form. Adjust as needed.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight.
2. Pull the dumbbell towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
3. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a dumbbell weight that allows for 10-12 reps per arm with proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure your core is engaged to maintain balance and prevent twisting during the exercise.
